comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] I would say so. Golly, what a fascinating mess! Is it from the Australian Gaslight site looking north? See 1895 interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
I think somewhere along there, but unable to match anything up yet ...
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362692823/]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
Perhaps closer to 1909? I think this may be looking from the same vantage point, but south -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5168027158/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Second thoughts (after a Bex and a good lie-down) - I think it is up a bit and round the corner. Photographer is on Millers Point looking NE across Walsh Bay (under destruction / construction) towards Dawes Point. Milsons Point on the far side of the Harbour. See notes about terraces and Chinese Christian Church. 1895 interactive map - this is what they were rebuilding - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The terrace from the other side - note the uneven spacing of the chimneys - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5414571594/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The church (see note top right - or is it a school?) was on the site of the current Harbour View Hotel, George and Lower Fort Sts. See this image not yet on Flickr - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]  We can see that Bex did a world of good. Now that you have added tags and landmarks, Millers Point totally makes sense. We couldn't quite wrap our heads around the perspective until the. Thanks guys :0
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Nice work! No wonder I couldn't reconcile it. And Walsh Bay was my first instinct, but I dismissed it! I'm more familiar with the Ferry Lane precinct, out of shot to the right.

[I hope that other image gets up on Flickr soon - we can see who's the first to tag it with "The Stror 'At Coot"!]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It's both a school AND a church: "St Joseph's Providence Roman Catholic School and Chapel" - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367463.html - also known as the Cumberland Street orphanage - www.dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/st_brigids_catholic_chur... Incidentally, the former Harbour View Hotel used to be on the opposite side of the intersection (would now be under the bridge approach) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367582.html

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Great detective work all! Read with great interest!

comment._content:
